alert.note: Alert for Pike (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 6:24AM CST until February 18 at 1:30PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in New Orleans LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tangipahoa River At Osyka affecting Pike County. For the Tangipahoa River...including Osyka, Kentwood, Amite, Robert...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tangipahoa River At Osyka. * WHEN...From this morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Pastures and woodlands along with some crop land near the river will be inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 14.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 15.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.6 feet on 10/28/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
